title: Writing Box Depicting King Solomon and the Queen of Sheba

thumbnail.alt_text: A work made of wooden box; beaded with silk and glass beads; appliquéd with beaded figures worked over cotton padding and silk, satin weave; embroidered with silk in satin and single satin stitches; couching and seed pearls; metal hinges.

medium_display: Wooden box; beaded with silk and glass beads; appliquéd with beaded figures worked over cotton padding and silk, satin weave; embroidered with silk in satin and single satin stitches; couching and seed pearls; metal hinges
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Arthur M. Wood, Mrs. Bertha Palmer Thorne, Mrs. Rose Movius Palmer, and Mrs. Gordon Palmer
exhibition_history:
The Art Institute of Chicago, European Needlework (Textile Furnishings) from the Permanent Collection, October 27, 1979–January 27, 1980

The Art Institute of Chicago, Department of European Decorative Arts, Gallery 68/69 case, February 22, 1994- January 20, 1995

The Art Institute of Chicago, Department of European Decorative Arts, Gallery 68/69 case, March 29- September 11, 1996

The Art Institute of Chicago, Department of European Decorative Arts, Gallery 68/69 case, February 20, 1997- August 26, 1998

The Art Institute of Chicago, Department of European Decorative Arts, Gallery 68/69 case, December 31, 1998- September 17, 1999

The Art Institute of Chicago, Department of European Decorative Arts, Gallery 68/69 case, February 9, 2001- May 31, 2002

The Art Institute of Chicago, Department of European Decorative Arts, Gallery 68/69 case, September 23, 2004- January 14, 2005

The Art Institute of Chicago, Department of European Decorative Arts, Gallery 68/69 case, January 10- June 13, 2006
provenance_text: Mrs. Potter Palmer [born Pauline Kohlsaat, died 1956], Chicago, by 1926 [on loan to the Art Institute of Chicago from 1926, incoming receipt R2689, Feb. 20, 1926, loan number 223.26]; by descent within the family; given to the Art Institute of Chicago, 1969.

input: Writing Box Depicting King Solomon and the Queen of Sheba
